item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 16, 2024 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Bluesky is currently gaining more than 1M users a day (143 points | 120 comments)
2. James Webb Space Telescope finds evidence for alternate theory of gravity (159 points | 69 comments)
3. Two galaxies aligned in a way where their gravity acts as a compound lens (148 points | 41 comments)
4. Logica – Declarative logic programming language for data (71 points | 28 comments)
5. SICP: The only computer science book worth reading twice? (2010) (145 points | 59 comments)
6. Show HN: I built a(nother) house optimized for LAN parties (288 points | 116 comments)
7. Statistical Rethinking (2024 Edition) (56 points | 11 comments)
8. The Difference Between a Standard DIMM and a Cudimm or Csodimm (21 points | 1 comment)
9. Yggdrasil Network (209 points | 77 comments)
10. Military's UFO-hunting aerial surveillance system detailed in report (72 points | 52 comments)
11. Netflix buffering issues: Boxing fans complain about Jake Paul vs. Mike Tyson (350 points | 640 comments)
12. Numpyro: Probabilistic programming with NumPy powered by Jax (63 points | 9 comments)
13. New haptic patch transmits complexity of touch to the skin (14 points | 4 comments)
14. I tried every top email marketing tool (89 points | 61 comments)
15. Optimizers: The Low-Key MVP (72 points | 4 comments)
16. Treating bullying as everyone's problem reduces incidence in primary schools (105 points | 93 comments)
17. Don't Look Twice: Faster Video Transformers with Run-Length Tokenization (35 points | 7 comments)
18. How to Redirect a Cloudflare Domain to Another URL (4 points | 1 comment)
19. C Compiler to SPIR-V (58 points | 5 comments)
20. Pleasant Debugging with GDB and DDD (56 points | 3 comments)
21. Kyanos: eBPF-based network issue analysis tool (169 points | 14 comments)
22. Is the UK's liver transplant matching algorithm biased against younger patients? (77 points | 44 comments)
23. Show HN: Android Dev Quest – A puzzle game solvable only using developer tools (57 points | 7 comments)
24. PermitFlow (YC W22) is hiring senior/staff engineers in NYC ( | hide)
25. Virtual Shoe Museum (11 points | 3 comments)
26. Surveillance and the history of 19th-century wearable tech (47 points | 12 comments)
27. Casio has released a ring in the form of its iconic watch (145 points | 59 comments)
28. Nixie Tubes (2015) (128 points | 38 comments)
29. The race to commercialise nuclear-powered batteries (29 points | 12 comments)
30. Tsugaru OS – A New Free FM-Towns OS (108 points | 16 comments)
